intro: Vicoa auriculata, commonly known as the ear-shaped leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, ear-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Vicoa auriculata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners and botanists alike.
